Frequently Asked Questions

Down

What is CBD?

CBD, short for cannabidiol, is the non-psychoactive portion of the cannabis plant, cannabis sativa, and it can also be found in the hemp plant. CBD can therefore originate from hemp or a portion of cannabis sativa. CBD is being used currently in medical research for which many medical uses are being found.

Is CBD legal?

In 2018, Congress passed the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018. In 2019, the act became effective in legalizing hemp or cannabis as long as it contains less than 0.3% of THC (psychoactive portion of cannabis). Thus, the bill removed hemp from the Controlled Substances Act and it expanded hemps commercial cultivation. It made hemp production legal in all US territories.

What are CBD Uses?

CBD has been used effectively for many types of seizure disorders, stress relief, anxiety relief, insomnia, neurodegenerative disorders like multiple sclerosis, Parkinsons disease, Alzheimers disease. CBD can help control inflammatory muscle spasms, pain, and even cancer by preventing cancer cell growth.

CBD is a very effective anti-inflammatory agent, and thereby, it can help with many maladies that cause muscle pain and muscle spasms, skin eruptions and irritability.
